Authors: Yun Geng, Qi Wang, Li-Yun Xia, Xiu-Guo Zhang
Title:
Characterization and phylogenetic analysis of the mating-type
loci in asexual genus Ulocladium
Abstract:
The availability of mating-type (MAT) loci sequences will
be useful to provide insight into the causes of lacking a known sexual
stage in asexual species of filamentous fungi. The entire MAT idiomorphs
and flanking regions of Ulocladium, a genus thought to be strictly
asexual, were sequenced and characterized for the first time. Both
MAT1-1-1 and MAT1-2-1 genes were detected within the same genome of
Ulocladium species, which are structurally similar to a homothallic
species. Moreover, both MAT genes were expressed and might be functional
in the asexual genus Ulocladium, indicated the potential for sexual
reproduction in Ulocladium species. To evaluate the phylogenetic
potential of mating-type sequences in Ulocladium, phylogenies based on
MAT genes were compared with GAPDH and Alt a 1 phylograms. MAT genes
showed high sequence similarity within genus and low levels of
conservation between different genera. The MAT genealogies and the
non-MAT tree displayed different topologies, suggesting that MAT genes
were unsuitable phylogenetic markers in Ulocladium. Furthermore, the
conflicting topologies between MAT1-1-1 and MAT1-2-1 phylogeny indicated
the separate evolutionary event for the two MAT genes.
